sciknow-25x1-scientific-papers.title: Secure Authentication and Trust Management Scheme for Edge AI-Enabled Cyber-Physical Systems
sciknow-25x1-scientific-papers.abstract: Cyber-physical systems (CPSs) connected in the form of the Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) are susceptible to various security threats. Due to the extensive deployment of infrastructure for IIoT devices, the trustworthiness and security of data are among the major concerns in CPSs. Therefore, establishing security measures against potential threats through trust assessment and trust authentication has become a key goal. Blockchain has the characteristics of traceability, anonymity, transparency, etc., and can achieve trust authentication for trust assessment. In our work, we propose a lightweight decentralized authentication and trust management scheme for edge AI-enabled CPSs that supports access control on the basis of extended chaotic maps, which meets the privacy and security needs of data transmission in a broader sense. Moreover, we develop a trust model for checking the trustworthiness of data collected by smart devices/sensor nodes. A formal security analysis is executed by utilizing the broadly applicable realor-random (RoR) model. Our scheme, which is different from previous methods, combines high security with relatively low communication and computational costs. Through an informal security analysis, we verify that our proposal is in compliance with the security requirements and can withstand various forms of attacks. Furthermore, the functionality and performance analysis results indicate that our method is better suited for lightweight validation in CPS networks while providing a higher level of security than other methods.

sciknow-25x1-research-problems.problemImportance: Ensuring the security and trustworthiness of data is critical for the reliable operation of CPSs and the protection against potential security threats.
sciknow-25x1-research-problems.businessRelevance: Improving security measures in CPSs has direct implications for industries relying on IIoT, such as smart manufacturing and healthcare, and can lead to safer and more efficient operations.

sciknow-25x1-methodological-frameworks.name: Secure Authentication and Trust Management Scheme for Edge AI-Enabled Cyber-Physical Systems
sciknow-25x1-methodological-frameworks.description: The study proposes a lightweight decentralized authentication and trust management scheme for edge AI-enabled CPSs using Hyperledger Fabric, an alliance blockchain. The scheme supports access control based on extended chaotic maps and includes a trust model for verifying the trustworthiness of data from smart devices/sensor nodes. The security analysis uses the real-or-random (RoR) model, and the scheme is evaluated for security requirements compliance and performance against other methods.

studyDesign.designDetails: The study uses a simulation-based approach to design and evaluate a decentralized authentication and trust management scheme for CPSs. The design leverages blockchain technology and chaotic maps for security and trustworthiness assessment.

procedures.procedureName: Design and Implementation of Authentication Scheme

steps.description: Utilize Hyperledger Fabric to build a consensus network and produce certificates and private keys via Fabric CA.
Register IIoT devices with Fabric CA to enhance system security and reliability.
steps.outputs: Registered IIoT devices with certificates and keys

steps.description: Develop a trust model to assess the trustworthiness of data collected by smart devices/sensor nodes.

procedures.procedureDescription: The procedure involves the design and implementation of a decentralized authentication and trust management scheme using Hyperledger Fabric. It includes the registration and authorization of IIoT devices, the generation of certificates and keys, and the establishment of a trust model for data trustworthiness verification.

dataAnalysis.summary: The study conducts a formal security analysis using the real-or-random (RoR) model and performs an informal security analysis to verify compliance with security requirements. Additionally, a comparative study is executed to evaluate the proposed scheme against existing solutions based on functionality features and computational/communication overhead.

resultsRepresentation.summary: The results indicate that the proposed scheme implements more features than other compared schemes and meets all the security requirements. The scheme is also shown to provide better security and additional features, making it well-suited for lightweight validation in CPS networks.

validationAndVerification.validationProcedure: The security of the proposed scheme is analyzed using the real-or-random (RoR) model, and its functionality and performance are compared with existing solutions.
validationAndVerification.validationResults: The proposed scheme is verified to comply with security requirements and withstand various forms of attacks, outperforming other methods in terms of security and functionality.
